author: lovetosing
title: Amazing stroke rehab service
body: Thank you so much to Leanne, Rhea and Margaret. They all said that I did all the work and I did all the exercises they gave me - but I wouldn't have known what to do without you. I've been amazed at all the help you've given and can't thank you enough. I'm back to doing everything again and will keep practising and keep improving. THANK YOU

title: Telephone issues
body: 2hours, 2call backs, over 120 redials, referred to push doctor as no appointments available, details on system are wrong, so can't register and get video appointments, then gp service cut call off!!!!!!!!? Its a joke!!!!!! I have lost the will to live, I can't talk, lost my voice, chest infection, and now crying my eyes out!!!!!!

author: RPaterson
title: Excellent screening
body: Thank you to the wonderful team at the breast clinic/radiology department at ARI. Dr Ragupathy picked up my breast cancer at a very early stage and I will forever be grateful. Michelle is an amazing radiographer who makes the process as smooth as it can be. All of the nurses including Lali and her team made me feel very comfortable. I am now prepared for my surgery. Many thanks again.

author: lacertayw44
title: Support for my friend
body:
My friend was a heavy drug user and I felt in some way that I had to be the one to support him and help him out as he didn't have anyone else. I took this on and to be honest it was way too much. I could not fix him and it became such a struggle. I felt like I was his parent and I was constantly focusing on how I could help and make him better.  
I finally reached out to PSL and I am so glad I did. I was supported, given helpful information which I could share with my friend and I was able to learn about boundaries and looking after myself which I had not been doing. Yes, I still see and support my friend but in a healthy way, it is not consuming my lifestyle anymore which has been a godsend. I think if I had carried on I would have just burnt out so massive thank you to PSL and how they have helped me.

author: JJ76
title: Everyone could not have been more helpful
body:
Having been a Health Care Professional for the past 25 years I think it is important to highlight good experiences as all too often it is the negative ones we hear about.  
I found myself going for emergency surgery and I can genuinely say that everyone from EPAS, Main Theatre, Reception/Recovery and the Gynaecology Ward were fantastic and could not have been more helpful. I especially want to mention Anna who was on a night shift. She made me feel at ease and nothing was a bother to her. She was extremely helpful, empathetic and caring, an asset within our NHS. She went out her way to ensure I was comfortable on a very busy shift. Thank you.

author: attendantnn78
title: There is nothing to improve upon
body:
I underwent major surgery in the Glasgow Royal to remove a cancerous tumour in my ovaries and bowel, I am still in just now.  
The care I am receiving is second to none, all staff are so friendly and caring. Nothing is too much other and nothing is a problem, considering they are so busy someone always sits and listens to you. The wards are cleaned to an immaculate standard.  
There is nothing to improve upon.

author: Cloughreagh
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I had a fall at home
body: I woke up and was listening to the radio so I tried to get out of bed and my legs left me. I crawled round to the other side of bed to get the phone and rang my son. I thought it was a stroke. My son rang for an ambulance. I was taken to Daisy Hill, Newry where it was confirmed it was a cluster stroke I was in Daisy Hill for a while, then transferred to Cloughreagh House, Newry for rehabilitation.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: telescopiumxg59
title: Appalling lack of crisis care
body:
My mum has long term severe mental illness where she gets very psychotic stops taking her medication and ends up very very unwell in need of a safe place. Which means admission to hospital because there is no crisis team that will go to her in time. And these crisis houses here don't take anyone with psychosis.  
She lives on her own and self neglects. We cant get near her when she is very paranoid and frankly we are sick to death of being dumped on for years and years by this Trust who have never had the workforce in place to support very unwell patients.  
It is not our job to look after our mother as the crisis line worker told my brother. It is appalling that this Trust expect us to put our entire lives on hold to provide the 24 hr care they should be doing. If they went in to her before she got so unwell then she wouldn't end up barricaded in her home with police smashing the door down (as now) and still no mental health assessment. We as family don't have any break and we have to try and hold down jobs, pay mortgages and rents and have children to care for AND provide acute mental health crisis care 24 hrs a day until we cant get access. There was NO mental health services during the entire pandemic ( and please do not tell us otherwise when we know her community team haven't made contact since her last section ). We are sick of the excuses the complaints managers post . Everything from where sit is toxic and rotten and dangerous and we don't think for a moment that these crisis services and wards and sectioning teams care the slightest or they would have improved the quality of frontline staff and more importantly the managers. This has gone on or at least 10 yrs now..  
2 of us are NHS nurses so we know what good care looks and sounds like and we know what dangerous decisions are. We concur with every criticism voiced by others on this site because at some point or another over time we as family or my mum as the patient has experienced the same.  
We post here not because we believe for a minute they will change but to stand in support with other families and patients who have been left in this position.

readBy.name: Camden and Islington NHS Foundation Trust

author: Hils 1951
title: The service I received was exceptional
body:
The service I received was exceptional.  
There were three staff at the Day surgery unit where I had my small operation, who treated me with such care .  
I cannot thank them enough as throughout the procedure they kept me entertained with their good humour .  
Please pass on my heartfelt thanks to all of them (Dr Scott, Lynn & David).  
They made my experience so easy .  
Kind Regards

readBy.name: Office of Michelle Thomson, MSP for Falkirk East

author: woodpeckergt68
title: Feeling positive about my future
body:
I had a serious drinking problem which was effecting ever aspect of my life. My health was deteriorating & I ended up a diabetic.  
Since starting inclusion I have come along way. I’m now a lot more confident in myself & I’m beginning to like myself. My health has dramatically improved with me being more active & more self aware. I still have a long way to go but thanks to the inclusion team I’m feeling very positive about my future.

author: BettyJack
title: My Mums rehabilitation after a stroke
body:
[Very happy with 'Staff skills']  
[Very happy with 'Other staff']

author: ElleC39
title: Colonoscopy cancelled again
body:
I'm commenting here on behalf of my partner who has just received a phone call cancelling his planned colonoscopy procedure for this afternoon. He was offered an appointment at relatively short notice and was careful to explain that he has recently had a positive covid test. He was reassured this would not be a problem - and then was called this morning and told his procedure would have to be cancelled and a further wait of 6 weeks endured, due to his positive covid test. Not only had he gone through the mental and physical preparation required for this but this is now the second time the procedure has been cancelled on the day. The first time, he was not given the appropriate preparatory medication at the pre-op clinic.  
We are both understanding of the huge pressures the NHS is currently under (I am an NHS employee myself) however, a lack of due care and attention has now resulted in tremendous upset and inconvenience for us and 2 wasted appointment slots for this procedure. This certainly doesn't build confidence at an anxious and unsettling time and could be easily avoided.

author: Amish82
title: Wonderful experience in Haematology
body: My Mum has very recently been diagnosed with a rare form of N.H.Lymphoma. Diagnosis had taken place, and CT scan results were in. I accompanied her to her first appointment at Haematology where we saw Mr Mason. He could not have been more helpful, considerate and clear. He took into account of my Mum, her diagnosis and other life aspects in a holistic way, and at a difficult and trying time, he was such a blessing to my Mum and our family. There have been many aspects of my Mum's care that I have been deeply unhappy with, but our experience - crucially, Mum's experience - at Haematology has given us so much confidence. Cannot thank Mr Mason enough for treating my Mum like a human being.

author: Lpate
title: Entire pregnancy and labour experience has been excellent.
body:
We had a planned c section due to our baby being breach, our antenatal care had been superb up to this date despite not always meeting with the same midwife.  
My waters broke in early February. I was very apprehensive about the labour knowing our baby was a footling breach. We arrived at labour ward and the team couldn’t have been more efficient yet keeping us calm and informed the whole way. Susie, the midwife in theatre was great support to myself and husband, surgeon Marianne and the team were excellent and I felt in safe hands the entire time!  
The team in labour ward were all faultless, in particular Roma and Christina who took excellent care of us all.  
Since getting home we have had excellent follow up care, Lynsay has been very supportive and easy to speak too. Overall our entire pregnancy and labour experience has been excellent.

author: Compman
title: Excellent service for blood test
body: Despite only one nurse on duty, 4 others had to look after Covid-19 children, I was attended to quickly and professionally.

author: Tommyqpr
title: My Stay at Dame Carol
body: My stay has been fantastic, staff been really supportive, 10 out of 10. Slept well. Food really good, Seth been good with his advice. Found the meditation really helpful. Alan has kept my spirits up, Nicola has helped me keep in touch with my keyworker and supported my discharge.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: Kprichards
title: Long waiting time
body:
I arrived at Musgrove Hospital in Taunton in early February 2022 at 16:30 with a bubbling sensation over my heart and chest area with pain that followed. I was seen to by a nurse, had blood taken and general checks. I was told to keep waiting in the waiting room several times for several hours at a time.  
I then got seen to again for an X-ray of my chest, and was then once again told to wait in the waiting room. It got to 23:00 where I just got up and left because the waiting time was an absolute joke.

author: Pops 61
title: Working together seamlessly to provide excellent care
body:
I am the primary child care provider for my Grandson.  
In October 2021 as is the normal routine, my grandson was dropped off at 8.50 am by his dad on his way to work.  
He was happy and showed no signs of being unwell. Within 20 minutes he changed significantly for the worse becoming hot and flushed and his temperature rising to above 39 degrees Celsius he was tired and listless and clingy towards me his breathing becoming rapid and laboured.  
I was very concerned and took him to the paediatric ward in Daisy Hill Hospital, my local hospital, where he was taken on to the ward by Siofra, Deputy Sister, in charge at the time. We were brought to a side ward and made comfortable and he was seen by Dr Nicola who prescribed a course of treatment. Nicola explained what was happening clearly and concisely using language that I understood, while Ciara and Shauna, two of the nursing team, took obs and prepared and delivered the treatment.  
And as he hadn’t improved any after the first course of treatment Nicola prescribed a second dose and put him on oxygen. In the background Meghan a student nurse was taking history and making preparation to admit him. He stayed in hospital for four nights under the care of this team. Through out this experience I was reassured, informed and put at ease by these professionals who worked together seamlessly to provide such excellent care. I am forever grateful and indebted to them.  
PS I should said that this all took place against the backdrop of covid 19 and all of the restrictions imposed by the pandemic with no detriment to the exceedingly high quality of care

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: NorrieK
title: Dialysis session
body: I have been dialysing in Stobhill for 3 years. I came back after my transplant of 13 years failed. My Nurse - Paulina is such a caring a person and very professional at the job. She is constantly checking on the patients, she is very attentive- absolutely 1st class. I feel relaxed when she starts my dialysis. I can't say enough about her. A 5 star Nurse. She is playing a big role in keeping me alive. Coming here feels like home, 'cause Pauline and other Nurses do such a good job.

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: eden2083
title: Thank you to Staff
body:
I am a patient on Eden ward and for last 6 to 7 months I have been on level 6 meals due to my teeth issues. Coming up to xmas 2021 I was feeling a bit low because I wouldn’t be getting a proper xmas day, boxing day or new year day meal. I spoke to ward staff about this and 2 HCAs off the ward took it upon themselves and spoke to the kitchen managers and chef and they came up with a meal for me for 3 days.  
What they came up with was just what I needed.  
I would like to thank staff on Eden and the kitchen for giving me the best meals they could with the choices they had so thank you.

author: Whathappenedtome
title: Some bad eggs make the whole experience negative
body: I was seen at Goodhope hospital for my pregnancy care. At almost every turn where consent was required it felt like it was always coercive bullying to get what the nurses wanted done. Even when I rang in to say my waters had gone, as had my mucus plug, and I was having contractions 5 mins apart, when I got to the hospital I was told I needed to be examined internally to make sure I was in labour. When I declined this as is my right (due to previous severe life changing trauma- again due to no consent)- advocating for myself- I was treated like I was committing a crime and did not deserve any help. I was then treated like a problem rather than with support and told well if you don’t let us check then we don’t know where to send you so I was just left in the waiting room asking/begging for some gas&air- which I didn’t get. Apparently as I wasn’t screaming it meant I couldn’t be in pain or labour. After begrudgingly making me wait for half and hour I was sent to the labour ward so they could decide what to do with me instead as I was wasting a bed apparently - whereby I could feel the baby starting to come.Thankfully the midwife I had in the labour room gave me gas & air as soon as I asked and 20 mins later my baby was born. While in the labour room the midwife gave me all the time I needed and asked what I wanted to do before sending me upstairs to ward 5 ensuring they knew I would need extra help due to my medical conditions regardless of having a normal vaginal delivery. Once on ward 5 I was seen for an obs checks once, and offered water in a jug and my child was seen to once by the hearing check nurse. Other than that I was left to get on with it, with no one checking on me to offer any help, support or assistance. There was another lady on the ward who was checked on constantly the entire time I was there, yet no one thought to check in on me.I struggled with breastfeeding due to not being mobile due to my medical condition and my baby struggling to latch and still am now at home. Even though my midwife had informed the ward that I needed rest until I was ready to go home, I was still asked if I was ready to go home later that evening. The next day again I was left to tend to myself. The one time I pressed the buzzer as something had fallen onto the floor into the next bay, the healthcare worker came to pick it up for me but was all huffy about doing it for me with a disgusted look on their face. So I didn’t bother pressing the button again. The health care worker was also the one who did the food round and was clearly very polite and friendly when asking the other lady what food she wasn’t for lunch/dinner- but completely cold and annoyed when asking me. The next day- I was given my medication by a nurse who said my first name only didn’t check any other details with me and left some pain relief but not the other medication that had been prescribed for me. They came round later to give me the other medication that should have given alongside the pain relief, but it was someone else’s antibiotics instead. I asked why I was getting antibiotics all of a sudden. They addressed me by a different name, so I said that isn’t my name. They ran off with the antibiotics but I still never got my other medication. Later on in the day I asked for some stronger pain relief as I was told this was an option available for me to get prescribed. The nurse who I asked said that I was not prescribed it. I said I know, but I was told I could get it prescribed when I needed/wanted it. They never came back with the pain relief- again I was forgotten. I didn’t have anyone come check on me till the next morning (while I was in pain all night) when the healthcare workers came to ask if I wanted breakfast. The same day after shift change a nurse walked in and just abruptly starting questioning in a slightly angry tone why I was still there and hadn't gone home, and that it was a 6 hour turn around. I was shocked and couldn’t believe I was being spoken to like that and it made to feel absolutely horrible. I told the nurse that it should say on my notes why I’m still here, but they started waving a paper saying it says nothing on here. I had to explain it all and they walked off not happy with my explanations or reasons. I was made to feel so low and underserving to be there even though I was not even pressing the buzzer to ask anyone for help. This happened again with another health care worker who was also annoyed that I was still there and had to offer me food. I decided to ask to be sent home while still struggling to get my baby to latch and suffering with pains and still not able to be mobile due to my health condition. The midwife who did my discharge paperwork was lovely and tried to help with the latching but as my discharge paperwork had started I didn’t have enough time to get to a place where I wasn’t struggling. Horrible experience.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

author: loveht49
title: Handled very maturely
body: I visited due to my partner receiving a positive result for an STI. The whole appointment was handled very well, including discussion about my sexual history, testing and examination, and treatment. I felt very comfortable throughout and was very impressed with how informative the member of staff was and how well looked after I was.

author: Debft85
title: Visit to A&E
body:
I hadn't been feeling well for a few weeks, shortness of breath. I had phoned my GP but with current restrictions it is difficult to get a face to face appointment. Initially I was given a phone consultation for 2 weeks time. Time went on and I wasn't feeling any better. I'm a fit person who runs 3 to 4 times a week and I was struggling to even walk very far without being out of breath. A week had passed and I phoned the GP surgery again and asked if I could see someone, again I was told there were no appointments but someone would phone me back. Diane (Nurse Care Practitioner) phoned me back and gave me an appointment that day. I was seen by Dr Simpson, who was very thorough and gave me antibiotics, requested bloods to be taken and referred me for a chest x-ray. I went for my chest x-ray on the Thursday, which I thought was going to be a straight forward process. As soon as the x-ray was taken the radiographer said I had to go to A&E.  
Once in A&E, Dr Lee, the emergency consultant, advised me that I had a right-sided pneumothorax, which was a bit of a shock. He was very good at explaining everything and what needed to happen. A chest drain was inserted and nurse Lisa held my hand through the procedure. I had a bit of a wait in A&E after the procedure but was grateful I got at bed in Dr Gray's. Once on Ward 5, the staff were great, nothing too much trouble. I spent a few nights on the ward and as a member of staff (non-clinical) it gave me a different perspective on what happens on a busy ward.  
Thanks to all the staff at Dr Grays, A&E, Dr Lee, Lisa and others, for keeping me calm and the staff on Ward 5, Alana, Steve, Fiona, Alice and Kelly (student) who had only been there for a few weeks, who was amazing with all the patients!  
Thanks again to Dr Gray's Hospital for looking after me, much appreciated.

author: oscarcj87
title: Thanks to your group
body: I had a stroke 6 years ago afterwards I did not receive much physio help but thanks to your group you are looking into my tablets to see if they are causing balance issues.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: running73
title: My experience at the clinic
body: Kelly was amazing. Her manner was very reassuring and non judgemental. She listened, gave good advice and showed care and respect throughout. Despite my dislike of needles, she looked after me and made sure everything went as well as possible for me. Thank you so much!

author: orangemp43
title: Good to have professional help
body:
I am in the city hospital, Belfast. The physiotherapist referred me to Joe, friends of the cancer centre's physical activity coach. He met me and assessed my physical activity level to determine how he could help me. He calls every other day, demonstrates the exercises suitable for my programme. I follow him, because I am hopeless with technology.  
He gave me pages of the exercises which include diagrams, description, how many times, how often to do them. I have been following this programme once a day and hope to increase to twice a day as I get stronger. It is good I have one to one professional help + support which will enables me to become more mobile.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: augustrh86
title: PREP
body: Amazing doctor and nurse. Everything went smoothly. I'm incredibly happy.

author: errandbk36
title: Excellent care
body: The care I got from the leg ulcer clinic was excellent, very friendly.

author: indiasp74
title: Great support
body: Very dedicated staff, all clearly well trained and I felt in good hands the entire time. I struggle with my memory but IHTT have supported me with this and made me feel better about it.

author: Ysera
title: First appointment
body: Dr Settle was amazing in every way. She listened to all my problems, the consultation was friendly but professional, examination was very thorough. The surgery overall is great. Waiting time is very reasonable. My most positive GP experience so far, I strongly recommend SGP and especially Dr Settle.

author: encryptionmm77
title: Helped so much
body:
All my carers has been so caring and understanding, listened too me. They made me feel at ease and helped me too recover, and shopping at Aldi also. I have put weight on. I would recommend IHTT because they have helped me so much to where I am now.  
Big thank-you to all the IHTT team.

title: belota cafe / horton hospital
body: always smashing coffee on offer, better than many coffee shops, very efficient, fast and professional service from all the staff, whilst having a warm and friendly approach, very inclusive. they set a very high bar for hospital catering services, and surpass them daily. i highly recommend them to my friends and family. please give them my thanks they make a stressful and difficult hospital visit a treat.

author: golfzm95
title: Friendly staff
body: Everything has been good. Very friendly staff.

title: Can't book appointments for future - not client…
body:
I was told I'm not allowed to book an appointment in the future and can only call at 8am. When I told them I work as a nurse and therefore can't call at that time (as one of many reasons why one may not be able to ring at that time), I was asked if a family member can call for me.

This is unacceptable that appointments can't be booked in the future and is indicative of bad management, which isn't customer centered.

What needs to change - Provide the option to make future appointments, as a tax payer citizen would expect.
As of now - this service discriminates against people like myself and people who may not be able to wake up early.

title: Excellent staff
body: I joined this practice early in 2021.  I have lived in London my whole life (50 years) and this is by far the best ever practice I have ever been joined to.  From reception staff through to nurses, doctors, referrals. The administration is slick, the appointments system fair.  An extremely well run practice.

author: avocetnt36
title: Professional and kind
body:
District nurses called to dress and drain a wound after surgery and for a picc line.  
At all time I was treated with professionalism and kindness. The nurses were always willing to answer my questions.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fabulous staff
body: The service I received was exceptional. I went for my pre op. Friendly, helpful, professional nurses not to mention the volunteer at the welcome desk . I do hope this reaches the relevant departments to say thank you to.

author: warmjh47
title: Helped so much
body:
So grateful to Ivor. I attended my podiatry appointment and he noticed that one of my feet was bruised and cut and slightly swollen. I explained I had a fall recently at home. I am also diabetic. Ivor examined my foot further and realized that I had possible broken bones. He finished the podiatry, but also put a boot on my foot and arranged for me to have an Xray at the Royal Hospital, who confirmed the bones were indeed broken and I need to wear a boot for twelve weeks.  
Ivor and the team are so professional, friendly, courteous and I just wanted to say my thank you.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Very professional and caring
body: From the start of the process, receiving an initial text message and being offered a suitable date for my scan and then confirmed by letter, the whole experience was very pleasant with professional and caring staff in attendance.

title: Renal Ward 9F - Thanks to the whole team
body: Thank you to the whole team working on Renal Ward 9F looking after my stepfather. You have all acted with care and compassion, highly professional but also with a real human touch. The whole family has really appreciated what you have done for him, and for accommodating his family as we spend time with him during his final days and hours.

title: 5 STARS A&e, river maternity unit & children's…
body: My son came into a&e with a deep cut on his head, we were greeted by a&e warmly and sent to the children's outpatients. I got completely lost and ended up in the river maternity unit, the nurses could not have been more helpful and lovely and one of them escorted us to childrens outpatients. The two nurses and doctor who accessed and treated my son were absolutely outstanding with their care and treatment of him. I left so lucky to have received such wonderful care from so many people. Thankyou all.

title: The Bush Doctors Terrible Service
body: Please do not register or go to or recommend The Bush Doctors. The reception staff are rude and lazy. They talk to each other, complain about patients and eat whilst they are at the desk. They give you wrong information making you go back and forth and make you feel like it’s your fault. The phone lines are always busy even though there’s enough staff members and barely anyone waiting. You can call endless times for long periods without answer. The calls cancel straight away. The doctors prescribe medication to only later tell you it’s not enough or wrong one. Or they prescribe medication that isn’t even available at a pharmacy. They say the prescription is sent to your pharmacy but they don’t send it until you chase them. They say their short staffed and or blame covid.

author: blackbirdxm36
title: Helped enormously
body:
I have just completed six sessions @ Chard Hospital balance & safety groups Integrated Rehabilitation service. I just wish I could have had another 6.  
My balance is improving but slowly & and I found the sessions helped enormously plus hearing other people in the same position was very helpful in that I didn't feel it was just me.  
I learnt many tips to help me & and sometimes just talking is good.  
The staff were brilliant - patient & knowledgeable. They watched us all the time to see if we were doing it right & helping us.  
My biggest fear is in the mind. I just dread falling again as I can remember each bad fall I have had & go through it in my mind - Its horrible.  
I would like to accept my gratitude for all you have done for me. Well done - keep it up.

author: columbagh56
title: Big thank you
body:
My feedback is generally very positive. I have just had my three month review following treatment for prostrate cancer. The team stay on top of it and I receive a very comprehensive report about my prognosis and going forward. I receive a first class service.  
Kath, is very engaging and when we speak there are no ‘elephants in the room’, nothing is sugar-coated, indeed we have frank discussions which is appreciated and helps me know the way forward with a clear plan.  
Big thank you to Kath and the team for their care and for continuing even through the negativity of Covid.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: CARING PRACTICE
body:
I have been going to this surgery for 55 years and always been very happy but in the last 5 years this surgery has excelled itself in patient care.
From the receptionists up who listen carefully to your request.
The nurses are kind caring, supportive, respectful and dedicated.
The doctors do their very best in these crazy times.
Park house do not change, you are in a word perfect.
A very grateful patient

title: Poor patient consideration
body:
Attending cataract surgery, the only person who introduced themselves was a Trainee nurse collecting me from the waiting area. Throughout my wait for the procedure no one discussed what was to happen, when and where and by who. I was marked up by the Consultant and another person in scrubs but I did not get know who that was - neither spoke to me. I was called through to the prep room where I was treated well, but again very little mention of what and who regarding the procedure. I was wheeled in horizontally and spun around noticing a female in a mask who did not introduce themselves, nor let me see who they were and she proceeded to operate on me. I was asked once if I was ok throughout. It was apparent that the Consultant intervened at the end. On finish I was patted on the shoulder and asked to go back to waiting room. The attendant walking back with me commented that I was a bit slow and wobbly! No consideration was given to how mI may feel especially having heart failure and AF and how this might compromise my ability to 'jump' off the table to walk quickly back to recovery.  I was given refreshments while I waited. One nurse wore a mask (Covid protection) under her nose throughout her time on the unit - one rule for some!! I was given some medication with no reason for its use given, and sent to find my own way out.
Clearly the team had setup a process that would enable them to turn around the 5 patients in a limited time slot for the theatre - what they forgot to do is realise the 'patients' are human beings.

author: castorbd97
title: Done a brilliant job
body:
Podiatry at the Causeway Hospital in Coleraine is a very good service. It is helpful in every way and has done a brilliant job for me and kept me informed on antibiotics.  
I couldn't ask for better. Thanks everyone.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic
body: Today, I had an appointment at outpatients for a Diabetic Retinopathy examination. Unfortunately, I had a bit of a melt down when checking in. The people at the desk were fantastic. And everybody I came into contact with was sympathetic, caring and supportive. You are great!

author: Enna96
title: A&E department
body: I was brought in by ambulance last night into a&e. I'm sadly covid positive again and the staff were just amazing and so professional. There was a nurse called Rachel and she honestly couldn't have done more for me. And I cannot thank you enough for all your wonderful help last night when dealing with a scary moment.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: a step further
body: My wife was cared for in the ICU during her last hoursDue to the Covid 19 restrictions I didnt have much time with her but was with her when she passed.They even sent a taxi for me&one to get me home in the small hours.I was moved by the care &dedication shown to Mary & to me to.Special thanks for the follow-up call to me from the ward staff.God Bless You All..Peter,husband of Mary'O'

author: Happs
title: Inflexible appointment system
body:
I don't understand why my local GP at Glenlea only offers on the day appointments. There are certain things that can be booked in advance (smear tests for example) but everything else is only offered on the day. This really doesn't work for me as:  
A) it is near impossible to get an appointment in the morning as they book up within minutes.  
B) As a teacher, it is really hard get out of class or to arrange cover on the day  
C) I never actually need an appointment on the day as my problems are either not that serious or I have rung in advance and I don't see why I should take appointments away from people who may need them desperately when I am willing to wait a few days.  
It makes making plans extremely hard as, if I need an appointment, I can't book it in advance to suit my life so end up having to put things on hold just in case I manage to be on of the lucky ones to get an appointment that day. Honestly, it seems mad to me and I find it really frustrating when friends and family are able to book appointments at their convenience.

author: rhinogk73
title: Couldn't manage without them
body:
Mum had had two falls in one day and appeared to be having hysterical episodes & her mobility had reduced drastically from the day before. We had a call from the falls team who had helped Mum up and advised us to call NHS 24, which we did. They advised that a doctor would attend.  
The doctor came but felt a more in depth assessment was needed + the hospital at home team came a while later. In the meantime we had a terrible time trying to get Mum to the stair lift and from there to the toilet. She kept having hysterics, not being able to move and screaming & crying - it was awful. The team arrived just as we were trying to get mum back to her chair in the living room - it was good that they saw exactly what was happening and he home circumstances. They did all the tests and arranged for mum to go into hospital the next morning - I stayed overnight - I got very little sleep.  
When Mum came home the discharge to assess team supported her until she was able to manage dressing, toileting + preparing food herself. She still has support in the morning, and exercises to do so that she manages the zimmer + rollator better. I couldn't have managed with out them but must admit to feeling anxious when they will leave us to it - there's no training to be a carer and no one asks you if you can actually do it.

title: Think this might not have any doctors
body: Gad an appoint for blood pressure 188/109. Fitted with a 24hr monitor. 157/99. Told result will be passed to group clinical Charminster  will be contacted in about????48 hrs  no call. Cholesterol 8.1 no f2f available told telephone consultation. 4 working days. They change it to a f2f but forget to tell me,so marked down as failed to attend. Next avaablw appointment another week. Care in the community this practice is not.

title: Great Treatment
body: I have recently been a NHS Patient at the Woodthorpe Hospital and had Knee Replacement Surgery. From my first consultation to my now aftercare, I cannot speak highly enough of all of their staff, and the Consultants and Nurses. I have received the same treatment and care from them as if I had been a Private Patient. So I would like to give a big thankyou to everyone at the Hospital.

title: Fantastic Doctor
body: The doctor at this surgery is brilliant. He listens to your problems and actually cares for his patients. When there isn’t an appointment available and I have needed help the reception staff and the doctor always still try to help as much as possible. The doctor never turns a patient away. He will try his best to help if he can’t help he will always send you to a service that can but he won’t leave you to struggle on your own. He is the best doctor I have ever had. Thank you for always helping me and my family.

author: matarbt75
title: Great service
body:
My counsellor made an appointment and regularly phoned on time. We spent in excess of 1 hour per session and was a very interesting in depth discussion and at no time did I feel threatened or under pressure.  
She also sent me back up copies of literature outlining what we had discussed, especially pain management which I found very useful. Many thanks for the service provided.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: triangulumxm39
title: Good and positive experience
body:
Overall my experience was good and positive. It has given me tools and skills that I've been collecting on every step of my journey. I learnt a lot and was comforted by staff's own journeys and knowing I wasn't alone.  
Activities were nice and pleasurable but I personally think there should of been more outside/ socialising activities to improve our skills ready for going back to reality and "normal life".  
I would of liked to have been encouraged to be more open and not feel ashamed around others/facing others. (family, friends etc).  
My time there was life changing but best decision I've ever made for myself.

author: maybz74
title: At ease straight away
body:
Dr Davis + Kayleigh are wonderful women. They put me at ease straight away and explained the procedure in depth so I understood fully.  
Quick and gentle procedure.

author: chachare39
title: Encouraging throughout
body: Brilliant! easy going, sensible & helpful conversation and encouraging throughout.

author: soilyz69
title: Urogynaecology clinic
body: Went for appointment and was feeling very nervous. I was there to see if I could put a catheter in as I'm going to get botox to help strengthen my bladder muscles, but the staff there made me feel very at ease (Nurse Lesley Ann and Joan). I will be seeing them in a fortnight to see if I have managed to fit it properly, hopefully I'll be like a darts player first try 🤭 then get my botox done .

author: browsernf87
title: Care I received in A&E
body: I was admitted to A&E SWAH, last month and had to stay for two days. The care I received was exceptional. Special thank you to staff nurse Ursula and Dr Quinn who cared for me with such professionalism. I felt at ease knowing I was being looked after so well. Thank you again.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: oscardt67
title: Looked after wonderfully
body:
I was diagnosed with myeloma cancer several years ago and although am I currently in remission I must say that the staff have been amazing and I have received wonderful care and attention from the staff throughout.  
The doctors, nurses and all the staff are wonderful and I couldn’t have got anything better.  
Dr Lufty, he is such a kind gentlemen  
Dr Gnu, she is sweet, kind and just so nice.  
Their teams, staff everyone just lovely. They really did save my life and I cannot thank them enough.  
I get regular 3 monthly tests and it feels good to know that I am being looked after and helped.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: ES22
title: Dermatology department
body: I felt nervous going in to my app until I was greeted by Kirsty and Laura. They were very professional and put me at ease. Every step was spoken through at the beginning of the procedure and then again as it was happening. They did a good job of keeping my mind off of what was going on and a few laughs and giggles were had, which was fab! David is also a good guy. Great team!

author: Parker my lady
title: Nothing is too much trouble
body:
I have had lymphodema care at the City Hospital Belfast for well over 3 years from Gillian and no one could get better treatment anywhere. Gillian goes over and beyond the call of duty and nothing is too much trouble for her. She has helped me manage my legs and gives me a telling off big time when I haven't done what she tells me to do. I moved to Belfast 24 years ago and find the N S C has looked after me far better than they ever did in England.  
Thank you and keep up the good work.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ddstego
title: Care plan related to previous falls on ward 51
body:
I posted a story about how poor care and communication led to my being injured in falls and how a nurse had told me I was “independent”. I have since requested my notes and discovered what might be at the root of this experience.  
I was admitted to hospital as a result of three falls at home and being in a state of confusion. I was subsequently diagnosed with a urine infection. This is documented in the hospital’s admission notes.  
However on my personal care plan across the topics of “mobility” and ‘personal hygiene” is scrawled “INDEPENDENT”. “Falls risk” is described as ‘LOW RISK”. This is repeated on each daily care plan until after my first fall. Interestingly on the heading of the care plan “Discussed with patient on...” is left blank.  
For me this raises a huge question as to what information this care plan was based on.  
I have fed this back to the ward manager and she assured me this would be discussed with staff. I include it here for the benefit of the people who read my original post.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath
St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Renysis
title: A really caring professional service
body:
I was discharged from Craigavon Area Hospital with a Renasys device. The district nurses called regularly to assess the wound and change the dressing. They introduced themselves and explained in detail what they were about to do. They proceeded in a calm professional manner, putting me at ease immediately. They assessed my wound and gave me the reassurance I needed.  
Once finished they made sure I was comfortable before they left. In conclusion I can only say they provide a really caring professional service and can not praise them highly enough.  
Heartfelt thanks ladies .

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: BeckyJG
title: All of the staff were amazing
body:
All of the staff, consultants, doctors, nurses, physios and ward staff couldn't have treated me better when I had a 3-week stay on SSIP at the John Radcliffe.  
Unfortunately, I had a complex fracture to my left leg which resulted in me being in an external fixator for 5 months.  
During my stay at the hospital, all of the staff couldn't do enough for me. They were amazing and I can't thank them enough for everything they did for me.

author: Amac2304
title: Good care from Ayrshire fertility unit
body:
I was referred to the fertility unit after 2 years of trying to conceive.  
I met my nurses Alison and Lyndsay and they have made what is a very stressful time much easier, they have been so helpful and so down to earth.  
I was very nervous at the start of the process going in for scans every other day but now I look forward to my little catch ups with them. I haven’t got my positive outcome yet but I am confident if anyone can help me achieve that it is Alison and Lindsay.

author: Roxy1234
title: Nice and professional service
body:
Had moles removed from my back, felt very relaxed and confident with the way it was carried out,nurses Kirsty and Alisha were very nice and professional,  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']  
  
[Very happy with 'Reception']  
  
[Very happy with 'Environment']  
  
[Very happy with 'Transport']  
  
[Very happy with 'Staff attitude']  
  
[Very happy with 'Staff skills']  
  
[Very happy with 'Team work']

author: Beauty1985
title: Success at coil fitting and screening
body:
4th time lucky! Could never had a coil fitted because I’m tiny and when GP tried it before they’ve always failed.  
In the clinic everyone was lovely, tried to distract me a lot, and managed to fit coil in. Not the most pleasant thing to get done but finally got it in.  
Staff was really nice, non-judgmental and open minded.

author: SC108
title: INCLUSION - Inclusive, Nurturing, Calming, Loving, Useful, Sincere, Innovative, Organised, Noble !!!.....
body:
There are many many more words I can think of to describe what Inclusion means to me but they all would still not wholly express the greatness of this service!  
It's been a challenging journey for us as a family for the last 3 years and so it continues.... However, there is a big difference now - we have the bestest support from the kindest team at Inclusion on the IOW  
It all began in the summer of 2019 when we realised the extent of my Son's alcohol addiction... it was sad to think that what we thought was just Uni fun had now become a serious problem. Nevertheless, we grouped together as a tight knit family, closed ranks, and started the rehab process as we thought this would be the best way to help this intelligent, sensitive and very worthy young man who had just completed his Masters Degree and had a whole world waiting out there to explore. Little did we know that it was not so easy. The next 2 years were a roller coaster ride for us all. My Son went from alcohol to cocaine and finally ended up using heroin. It was absolutely heartbreaking to witness with our own eyes the deterioration of this smart young man and we as a family were riddled with grief as we watched this tragedy unfold in front of us and with guilt too as we found ourselves with limited resources to help him in any way.  
Then everything changed for the better when we got our first appointment with Inclusion and had a home visit from the lovely Caroline. She took my Son under her wing and from then on, we had real help for the first time ever and it was amazing! She got him introduced to the AA program on the Island and this was a good turning point. Soon however, there was a not so good turning point and my Son suffered a set back. This time, due to his age, we had the adult services kick in and it was the most wonderful Aaron who took over his case. I cannot begin to express our overwhelming gratitude for Aaron's involvement and the brilliant support that his team have offered not only to my son but also to me.  
Along with getting my Son the help he needs and monitoring this, Aaron has always been there for me too... A shoulder to cry on initially, an ear to listen always, a mind to advise when needed and a professional to follow through on all fronts!! All these saviours encapsulated into one is Aaron! I feel so very thankful for my good fortune to have met him!! Now, at long last, I feel I can get my personal life back on track knowing my Son is in the safest hands possible!!  
It won't be an exaggeration to say that having Aaron on board has not just saved one life but many more. We all as a family are now able to focus on ourselves and each other and together we have hope for the good times ahead as we look forward to welcoming the future with sincere gratitude and excited anticipation!  
Many, many thanks to not only Caroline & Aaron but to also ALL of you in Team Inclusion!!  
Eternally Grateful!!

author: Samjk33
title: Dealing with anxiety
body: I had to phone into work sick one day Sept 2021 as I couldn't stop crying and I felt everything was getting on top of me. I felt so low and I couldn't put my finger on exactly what was wrong. I didnt know how to change the way I was feeling and I couldn't see any way forward.

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: Fneil
title: You helped me through
body:
Thank you so much to Kirsty and Laura for helping me through my biopsy appointment.  
You were both so professional and helpful.  
It is no fun being on the 'otherside' but you helped me through it.  
Thank you :)

author: Patient2022
title: Caring service
body: From the first call to leaving the appointment they were super kind, caring and understanding. Couldn’t have asked for more in a difficult time. Thank you

title: Lovely friendly Practice
body: My family have been with the Practice for many years. We have always found all the staff extremely helpful and friendly. Any referrals or follow up treatment has been dealt with quickly and efficiently. The staff are all lovely, having worked through some very challenging times. Well done all.

title: Excellent service
body: Very helpful staff. Answered all my queries. Guided me through all my excercises and gave me alternatives if I was struggling

author: A Pnb96
title: Hit a brick wall when asking for help
body: Absolute systematic failure on all levels. My son cried out for help and was ignored and laughed at then questioned repeatedly about his sexual orientation. As a parent with a highly suicidal teen I was also ignored and hit brick walls repeatedly when asking for help

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Great nursing staff
body:
I was brought to Craigavon hospital in an ambulance on Monday. The ambulance was quick to arrive which I really appreciate. I spent a short amount of time in ED, all the nursing staff on this ward were great. Not long after I was brought to 1 north, where I have been made to feel very comfortable by all the staff.  
The choice of food has been fine and the food itself is okay, I believe it could be better. Although, other than that my stay at the hospital has been great, I am being well looked after.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Great practice
body: Hi! I had 6 weeks of session therapy. All I can say is that I'm a new person after all. Great technics, great therapist,

title: Great practice
body: Efficient and caring service. Proactive and empathetic. I was extremely impressed by the advice I was given.

title: Kind and caring nurse
body: I attended for a smear test today and was quite nervous as a previous one was unsuccessful, which was not due to the nurse. I was pleasantly surprised that the nurse had remembered me and had set everything up ready to make things easier for me. It was all over with in minutes. All my questions were answered and I was never rushed. Thank you for your patience

title: Friendly
body: I'm a great believer of treat people as you wish to be treated and as such, I've never had a bad experience at this medical centre that i have been coming too since it first opened, way back. I've always gone in with a positive attitude and a smile and in return, i get the same back. I don't ask to see any particular Dr but when i see one guy, we have great banter.  You get back what you give and we all work hard. The new E service is great. Saves wasted visits as I'm sure many visits can be resolved virtually. Thanks.

title: Wonderful Service
body: I had to visit the UCC and Trafford general a few times over the past month. The care has been wonderful. A highly efficient hospital that has superb staff that really care about the patient experience.

title: Great hospital
body: Excellent kind staff very clean and efficient couldn’t ask for better treatment from start too end and excellent follow up treatment

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I attended the Urology dept .yesterday and although they were very busy and running late my treatment was excellent .The nurse and doctor both apologised for the wait (although it wasn’t too long)and the consultation was very reassuring and I was given time to ask questions about my concerns .Well done .

title: Amazing staff
body: Had a procedure done here and the staff were friendly, professional and extremely caring.  Thank you.

title: Minor injury
body: I visited the minor injuries department for a foot injury that I had suffered 3 weeks before. The 2 members of staff - the nurse who booked me in and the nurse practitioner who examined me could not have been kinder and friendlier. I was completely reassured by the professionalism and thoroughness with which the examination was conducted.  It is such a blessing to know that we in the South Hams have such a service. Thank you.

title: So grateful for excellent care
body: I have recently had two very worrying illnesses and have been so grateful for the prompt and caring attitude from all staff to help me. I was offered a home visit as I could not get to the surgery. The follow up is excellent

title: Breast reconstruction
body: Fantastic results from the team at whiston after having a mastectomy  they have made me feel whole again lovely hard working staff and amazing results I was also well looked after by nurses and the lovely physios  down to the singing tea ladies

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Saved from Sepsis
body:
My swollen and painful thumb arrived at the Plastic Surgery dept a couple of days after the initial evaluation through other departments at QA. Further evaluation and minor surgery under local anaesthetic revealed significant infection which was immediately dealt with. Two further appointments for dressing and post-op hand care rehabilitation.
All very professional, sympathetic and impressive. Thank you to all for saving me from sepsis.

title: First Class
body:
We are so lucky to live in this area and even more lucky to have access to fantastic health care.
Everyone at these two surgeries are fist class and go that extra mile to offer the best possible service.
Awesome.

title: Excellent postnatal care
body: I would like to thank the team at the surgery for their excellent care for my newborn son and I - the reception team efficiently organised our appointment for our 8 week GP check and vaccinations. At our appointment the GP was caring, knowledgeable and supportive. She took time to ensure we were both well and recovering as expected. The practice nurse, immediately after for vaccinations was very reassuring and supportive of a first time mum, explaining as she went along and what to expect afterwards. I have always found the care at the surgery excellent - many thanks again.

title: Great service
body: I would like to say thanks and well done to the two ladies who made my visit to the Xray department at the Royal Preston hospital yesterday (for a doppler of my carotid artery) a great experience. They made me feel totally at ease, talked me through the procedure checking that I was ok throughout. Two such lovely ladies who deserve a big THANK YOU.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Very helpful and efficient service my daughter had a telephone consult and prescription same day for tonsillitis which had become very painful for her

title: My Practice
body: Too many patients taken on with less Doctors. The doctors on duty did a great job in difficult cercumstances

title: Reassuring
body: After a telephone appointment I was given a Face to Face appointment regarding my issue . The Advanced Nurse Practitioner was very helpful and reassuring

title: Great Practice
body: my medication review was simple. I used e-consult to contact my GP, I was messaged the next day and I am very satisfied with care provided.

title: 1st class
body: I was referred here by my optician and couldn't have asked for more professional treatment by all the people who work there.1st class in every respect.

title: A Great Practice
body: I can only speak as I find.  We are all so quick to complain & write negative reviews, but I can honestly say I have never had a bad experience at this surgery.  I have always found both the Drs, nurses, and reception staff to be extremely friendly and professional.  I rang yesterday for an appointment, I was quite emotional at the time, the receptionist showed nothing but compassion and professionalism.  A Dr rang shortly afterwards.  Thank you so much.

author: paprika33
title: The team are a real credit
body: I have never been in this situation before. I accessed the service earlier this week and again today. I was given an appointment promptly both times, all the staff where beautiful. I cannot thank them enough for making me feel at ease, the respect and dignity I was shown will not be forgotten. The team at shropshire sexual health clinic are a real credit,
